data.text: @Lamentedtraffic @Kryg54325162 On the way out he would’ve done us all a favor.

@dotcom2020s @Kryg54325162 he never had the authority to directly fire fauci anyway. most he could do was try to nudge him out, and that would've tanked his "popularity" even worse while numbers continued to climb, and it would clearly be politically motivated

@GaleMorrisonEd @carol_psych @CherylDurwin @CDCgov @ECDC_EU My daughter’s PreK teacher is from Spain. She reminded me that children were unable to leave their homes about 6 weeks during the initial lockdown.
@carol_psych @CherylDurwin @CDCgov @ECDC_EU Hmmm… I think EU is better on vax for kids and evidence…. Not on some other things Covid
@carol_psych @CDCgov @ECDC_EU Actually Europe is better at most things so this is no surprise 😂
@carol_psych @CDCgov Their agencies are not as beholden to Big Pharma as ours.  I followed UK and Israeli data because they US CDC data was so substandard by comparison.  Truly embarrassing.
@carol_psych @CDCgov @ECDC_EU US response far from stellar, compared to Scandinavia.

@dotcom2020s @carol_psych @CDCgov @ECDC_EU Sorry, but that's not the worst thing he ever did. On my list of all the bad and nonsensical things Trump ever did, not firing Fauci wouldn't even crack the Top 500!
